notes: The evidence provided does not establish a normative constraint between pollByte and pollPDU within the same IE. The evidence mentions conditions for including a poll but does not specify a direct relationship or dependency between the two fields.

meta.evidence:
- increment PDU_WITHOUT_POLL by one; - increment BYTE_WITHOUT_POLL by every new byte of Data field element that it maps to the Data field of the AMD PDU; - if PDU_WITHOUT_POLL >= pollPDU; or - if BYTE_WITHOUT_POLL>= pollByte: - include a poll in the AMD PDU as described below.
---
\begin{tabular}{l} si-PollByte Parameter value of pollByte for RLC AM for NR sidelink communications, see TS 38.322 [4]. Value k B 25 corresponds to 25 kBytes , value k B 50 corresponds to 50 kBytes and so on. infinity corresponds to an infinite amount of kBytes. \end{tabular} \begin{tabular}{l} s/-PollPDU Parameter value of pollPDU for RLC AM for NR sidelink communications, seeTS 38.322 [4]. Value p 4 corresponds to 4 PDUs, value p 8 corresponds to 8 PDUs and so on. infinity corresponds to an infinite number of PDUs. \end{tabular} \begin{tabular}{l}
